Append on the URL of your request: &apik: Añade a la url de la petición: &apikey=APIKEY
Add the HTTP header: \"Authorization: Be: Añade la cabecera HTTP:"Authorization: Bearer APIKEY"
Set the input entry time manually: Establezca el momento de ingreso de la entrada manualmente
To post data from a remote device you wi: Para enviar datos dede un dispositivo exterior necesitará incluir en la URL su apikey de escritura. Ésta concede a su dipositivo permisos de escritura en su cuenta emoncms, permitiéndole subir datos.
For example using the first json type re: Por ejemplo para usar la petición con el primer tipo de json que aparece arriba sencillamente añada la apikey al final así:
The first number of each node is the tim: EL primer número de cada nodo es el offset temporal (véase abajo).
Optional offset and time parameters allo: El offset opcional y los parámetros temporales permiten al emisor fijar la referencia temporal para lo paquetes. Si no especifica nada, se asume que el último paquete acaba de llegar. El tiempo para los otros paquetes se calcula de forma acorde.
Legacy default format (4 is now, 2 is -2: Formato predeterminado legado (4 es ahora, 2 es -2 segundos y 0 es -4 segundos desde ahora):
Time offset format (-6 is -16 seconds to: Formato de offset temporal (-6 es -16 segundos desde ahora):
Sentat format: (useful for sending as po: Formato de envío (útil para ser enviado como índice positivo de tiempo incremental):
Absolute time format (-6 is 1387730121 s: Formato de tiempo aboluto (-6 es 1387730121 segundos desde 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC))
List of inputs with latest data: LIsta de entradas con los datos más modernos.
Set input fields: Modifique los campos de las entradas
Clean inputs without a process list: Limpie entradas sin una lista de procesos
Get input process list: Obtener lista de procesos de una fuente
Set input process list: Modificar lista de procesos de una fuente
Input API Help: Ver ayuda para el uso de la API
Inputs are the main entry point for your: Las entradas son el principal punto de acceso para su disposotivo de monitorización. Configure su aparato para enviar valores a ellas, quizás quiera seguir la API de ayuda para entradas como guía para elaborar tu petición.
Deleting an Input will lose it name and:
Borrar una entrada eliminará su nombre y su lista de procesos.
Una nueva entrada se crea de forma automática por la API de envío de datos si ésta no existe.

If you want to call any of the following: If you want to call any of the following actions when you're not logged in, you can authenticate with your API key:
Alternatively, use the encrypted input m: Alternatively, use the encrypted input method to post data with higher security.
The EmonCMS HTTP input API provides thre: The EmonCMS HTTP input API provides three ways of sending data to EmonCMS:
<b>input\/post<\/b> - Post a single upda: input/post - Post a single update from a node as either one data item or as a JSON data structure.
<b>input\/bulk<\/b> - Bulk upload histor: input/bulk - Bulk upload historic data from multiple nodes in a single update.
<b>encryption<\/b> - An encrypted versio: encryption - An encrypted version of both of the above.
If you're starting out with EmonCMS, 'in: If you're starting out with EmonCMS, 'input/post' is a good starting point for testing. This was emonCMS' original input method. The EmonPi/EmonBase uses the 'input/bulk' input method to post to a remote EmonCMS server as that method provides an option to efficiently upload buffered data after an internet connection outage. Combining multiple updates in a single input/bulk request also reduces bandwidth requirements.
For applications where HTTPS or TLS is n: For applications where HTTPS or TLS is not available, EmonCMS offers an in-built transport layer encryption solution where the EmonCMS apikey is used as the pre-shared key for encrypting the data with AES-128-CBC.
The <b>fulljson<\/b> format is recommend: The fulljson format is recommended for new integrations. It uses the PHP JSON decoder and the answer is also in json.
The <b>json like<\/b> format is based on: The json like format is based on the CSV input parsing implementation and maintained for backward compatibility.
The <b>node<\/b> parameter can be an unq: The node parameter can be an unquoted string e.g: emontx or a number e.g: 10.
Time is set as system time unless a <b>t: Time is set as system time unless a time element is included. It can be either a parameter &time (unquoted) or as part of the JSON data structure. If both are included the parameter value will take precedence. Time is a UNIX timestamp and can be in seconds or a string PHP can decode (ISO8061 recommended). If you are having problems, ensure you are using seconds not milliseconds. If part of the JSON data structure is a string, the node value will report NULL
The input\/post API is compatible with b: The input/post API is compatible with both GET and POST request methods (POST examples given use curl).
JSON format - with time (as a string in: JSON format - with time (as a string in this example)
Efficiently upload multiple updates from: Efficiently upload multiple updates from multiple nodes.
The second number is the node id. This i: The second number is the node id. This is the unique identifier for the wireless node.
All the numbers after the first two, are: All the numbers after the first two, are data values. The second node here (node 17) has two data values: 1437 and 3164.
Named feeds (similar to the main example: Named feeds (similar to the main example but updates the keys "data" and "anotherData" for node 19)
For applications where HTTPS or TLS is n: For applications where HTTPS or TLS is not available, EmonCMS offers an in-built transport layer encryption solution where the emoncms apikey is used as the pre-shared key for encrypting the data with AES-128-CBC.
